meanings.definition: (verb) to accumulate or increase over time
meanings.sent1: Money was accruing in his savings account.
meanings.sent2: Interest keeps accruing on the loan.
meanings.sent3: The snowball effect of accruing wealth made him smile.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge was accruing like a snowball rolling down a hill.
meanings.sent5: The joy of accruing memories with loved ones is priceless.

meanings.definition: (verb) to be received or obtained by someone
meanings.sent1: She was accruing praise for her hard work.
meanings.sent2: The benefits of the program started accruing to the participants.
meanings.sent3: Accruing compliments made her day brighter.
meanings.sent4: His efforts were accruing recognition from all around.
meanings.sent5: Accruing rewards for good deeds is always fulfilling.
